title: Harperrig Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Richard Webb / Baad Park and Harperrig reservoir.
images.caption: Baad Park and Harperrig reservoir. The reservoir was created in 1860 as part of a scheme to improve the supply of drinking water to Edinburgh.

images.title: Richard Webb / Cairns Castle
images.caption: Cairns Castle. The tower was built to control traffic using the important Cauldstane Slap pass. Today the pass is only defended by keep out signs.

images.title: Richard Webb / Water of Leith
images.caption: Water of Leith. Looking upstream from where the river enters the Harperrig reservoir.

images.title: M J Richardson / Low water at Harperrig Reservoir, from Auchinoon
images.caption: Low water at Harperrig Reservoir, from Auchinoon. The reservoir is one of a series on the Water of Leith used to manage the water levels downstream to Edinburgh

description: This walk visits Harperrig Reservoir in West Lothian near the Pentland Hills. There's nice easy footpaths running along the tranquil waters with fine views to the surrounding countryside and hills. You can start the walk at the car park at the western side of the water. Here you can enjoy views of the Water of Leith and the ruins of Cairns Castle which dates back to 1440. The area is also good for wildlife spotting with various wildfowl and the Eurasian otter to look out for. The Cross Borders Drove Road runs past the eastern end of the lake. You could pick up this long distance footpath to continue your walk. It runs south through the Pentland Hills to West Linton, Peebles, Traquair and then on to Hawick via the Yarrow Valley.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the west you'll find more nice trails around Cobbinshaw Reservoir. If you head towards Edinburgh there's Harlaw Reservoir and Threipmuir Reservoir. Here you'll find a visitor centre and circular footpath around the reservoir. To the east of here there's the Flotterstone Glencorse Reservoir and the climb to the viewpoint at Scald Law. Head north towards Livingston and there's the pretty Eliburn Reservoir in Eliburn Park. For more walking ideas in the area see the Pentland Hills Walks page.
